Message.Title: Japan has entered a bear market officially.
Message.Msg: Market dropped over 6% - added to the loss of previous 7 sessions, the total decline exceeded 20%, hence the criteria of a bear market are fully met. Global markets will undoubtedly get the fallout, US included. The MoMo stocks (of which NVDA is no longer one) got hit the worst because of the rising Yen and the forced closure of "carry trade"

Message.Title: "Intel, AMD Are Big Winners at WWDC"
Message.Msg: "Intel, AMD Are Big Winners at WWDC" "As Apple's fortunes have risen with the runaway success of its ARM-powered iDevices, the opposite has happened to Intel and Advanced Micro Devices. But at this week's Worldwide Developer Conference, a funny thing happened—with no new iPhone or iPad announced, the hardware spoils all went to the two standard-bearers for x86. " Source: pcmag

Message.Title: Short Int in NVDA Surges 86.4%
Message.Msg: for the 05/31/2013 settlement date, which shows a 27,375,853 share increase in total short interest for NVIDIA Corp (NASD: NVDA), to 59,061,958, an increase of 86.40% since 05/15/2013. Average daily volume for NVDA at the 05/31/2013 settlement decreased to 8,742,396, as compared to 10,047,666 at the 05/15/2013 report. That brought “days to cover” up to 6.76, a 114.23% increase from the 3.15 days to cover calculated at the previous short interest data release. full story on forbes Doesn't shorty know NVDA is retiring shares?

Topic.Title: shield

Message.Msg: The truth comes out. Nvidia thinks the handheld Shield will compete with Xbox and PS4 consoles. Good article with quotes from peterson. The only thing they're not saying is this is the Google Shield! Pushing the Android platform as a straw man. But Shield in the future could become an alternative to consoles as gaming on Android gains popularity and graphics hardware improves, Petersen said. Android is being widely adopted, there is a growing gaming developer base, and titles will be less expensive in Android stores, Petersen said. “If Android gaming continues to get better—that’s our goal and that’s what we’re spending a ton of money to do—the differentiation of a console becomes less and less. Sooner or later you’re going to hit this inflection point,” Petersen said.

Message.Title: NVIDIA CEO sees sales of chips to cars increasing to $1 billion
Message.Msg: --sales of the NVIDIA's processors for use in cars will keep doubling every year to reach $1 billion annually as automakers seek to attract consumers with advanced features. (Up until now it has been relatively slow) --about 30 new models using Nvidia’s Tegra processor will be introduced in the next two to three years Source: a new Bloomberg/Business Week interview with JH Huang. Google the subject title as it appears.
